EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting operations.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water; its connection point is at (-7.5, 24.5).
• Boiler (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Fueled with coal; its water input is intended at (2.5, 19.5). Multiple automatic connection attempts using candidate PipeGroups (fluid_system values 14310, 14450, 14730, 14870, 15010, 15435, 15578, 15710, 15850, 15990, 16130, 16270) and a manual L-shaped pipe route have all failed.
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; remains unconnected with fluid connection warnings.

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – Comprised of small electric poles linking production components.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Connection & Intermediate Node Failures
 - Verify that both source and target connection points (e.g., the Offshore Pump’s output at (-7.5, 24.5) and the Boiler’s water input at (2.5, 19.5)) are unobstructed and in close proximity.
 - Ensure that the fluid available meets the receiving entity’s requirements.

• Pipe Placement Distance Issues
 - When manually placing pipes, ensure that the player is sufficiently close to the target position; for example, the horizontal placement failure at (-6.5, 24.5) occurred because the player at (0, 0) was too far, exceeding the allowed maximum distance.

• Conflicting Entity Obstructions
 - Confirm that the target tile is free of any occupying objects before placing an entity.

• Fuel Insertion Failures
 - Verify sufficient fuel (e.g., coal) is available in inventory prior to initiating refuel operations.

• Historical API & Placement Pitfalls
 - Validate candidate build regions and ensure proper API function usage to avoid type errors and invalid calls.

• PipeGroup Merging and Manual Connection Failures
 - Confirm that valid PipeGroup candidates exist when attempting to bridge fluid networks; repeated attempts using fluid_system identifiers (14310, 14450, 14730, 14870, 15010, 15435, 15578, 15710, 15850, 15990, 16130, 16270) have failed.
 - For manual L-shaped pipe placements, ensure that the starting position is within the allowed range to prevent distance-related errors.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position. Returns the entity on success; raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the designated direction to correct its alignment during placement.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
 Attempts to insert a specified quantity of the resource into the target inventory. Returns the updated target on success; raises an exception if the resource is unavailable.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
 Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection between a virtual candidate connection point and the boiler’s connection point based on the specified pipe prototype. Raises an exception if the fluid conditions at the source do not match those required by the target.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) [Type: OffshorePump] – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) [Type: Boiler] – Represents the original boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump to the Boiler.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) [Type: Position] – Candidate intermediate connection point for linking the Boiler to the Steam Engine.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Boiler’s water supply at (2.5, 19.5).
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) [Type: Position] – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s steam input at (3.0, 5.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipe network segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) [Type: Position] – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement at (-1.5, 17.5).
